description: Audsley lists this stop with the following description: Literally Mouth-Flute. An open labial stop of metal, and of 2 ft. pitch; similar in all essentials to the French Flûte à Bec. The stop has no distinctive flute tonality. A stop under the name exists in the Organ in the Cathedral of Königsberg. Wedgwood gives the same definition as Audsley, though in fewer words.
